page.title: 18Tourism in Wilton & District
page.content: Wilton House, a stately home of Britain, is the main attraction for tourism. It attracts 100,000 visitors a year, anxious to view the house with its elegant rooms, its many treasures, its world famous Art Collection & the lovely gardens with the Palladian Bridge. The Parish Church with its Italianate building, German & French stained glass, marble from Spain, mosaic from Italy, Flemish carving, Caen stone & ancient glass beckons visitors from many countries. Devotees of George Herbert the poet, will find the former rector buried in the Chancel of Fugglestone Church. America is linked to Wilton by the statue of an early Bishop of Salisbury over the doorway of St.Mary's Church. His descendant was a former American Ambassador to Britain.The Wilton Royal Carpet Factory has tours for visitors.
